bug.author: luiscruz
bug.summary: I can't pull the repository without facing merge conflicts
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Right after cloning the repo, if I do a pull I have merge conflicts. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
git clone https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit git pull origin master
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
No conflicts. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Here's the output: <denchmark-code>git pull origin master From https://github.com/luiscruz/streamlit * branch master -> FETCH_HEAD warning: Cannot merge binary files: frontend/cypress/snapshots/linux/2x/add_rows.spec.ts/stVegaLiteChart-9.snap.png (HEAD vs. 0696711254331f82f230a3ab01031b7fd8db583c) warning: Cannot merge binary files: <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
No idea. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
current head commit: 0332099 Mac OS 10.14.6 git version 2.20.1 (Apple Git-117)
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
N.a.

comments.comment: This happened because I was merging from the branch. I should have used instead, as described in the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/wiki/Contributing#2-grab-the-code>"Contributing" wiki page</denchmark-link> .
